txt.en: 'Go now to camp of gorgûn.'
The wind gently sighs through the branches of the Blood-cloak as you approach
'I thank you. I found what is left.'
The Blood-cloak is at TBD, in Drû Bhûta, and is the location where the Wild Men perform their funerary rites.
Book 5, Chapter 4: The Hated Orcs
'Wild Men walk the forest with speed.'
Enter Maudhúl Grak and draw the enemy's eye
'Wild Men know secret way.'
'My brother Bhai-buri-Ghân rests here now.'
Proceed further into Maudhúl Grak and draw the enemy's eye
'There is sorrow here. There is gladness too.'

'My son Khôr-buri-Ghân not only kin. Bhai-buri-Ghân was eldest, but slain by gorgûn. Body taken to camp on road, north of forest. Khôr-buri-Ghân asked to recover body of brother. Ghân granted request. Help with task, and Ghân will offer aid to horse-men.

'Go now to camp of gorgûn. Help Khôr-buri-Ghân and Wild Men help you.'

<rgb=#FF0000>You will automatically travel to the Orc-camp when you accept this quest.</rgb>
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân at the Blood-cloak in Drû Bhûta
'Many gorgûn inside, [placeholder]. Draw their eyes to you. Khôr-buri-Ghân will slay them from hiding. They will pay for death of Wild Men. They will pay for death of Bhai-buri-Ghân.'
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân in Maudhúl Grak
'DNT - Blah!'
Talk to Ghân-buri-Ghân in Drû Bhûta
Travel to the Blood-cloak in Drû Bhûta, on a rocky cliff on the eastern side of the huge waterfall

'I thank you. I found what is left of Bhai-buri-Ghân. I bring my brother back to Drû Bhûta. Go to Ghân-buri-Ghân and tell him what we did. Tell him we braved gorgûn, and Bhai-buri-Ghân no longer remain in clutches.'

<rgb=#FF0000>You will automatically travel back to Drû Bhûta when you finish speaking with Khôr-buri-Ghân.</rgb>

'Wild Men walk the forest with speed. My son Khôr-buri-Ghân already returned. He brings his brother to the Blood-cloak. Go to him there. Wild Men mourn deeply, but not long.

'After you go to the Blood-cloak, Wild Men seek out the Horse-men. We will help them. They need fear no gorgûn. Wild Men know secret way.

'Blood-cloak is to east, atop hill on far side of falling water. My son Bhai-buri-Ghân rests there now.'
'DNT - Blah!'
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'My brother Bhai-buri-Ghân rests here now.'
The Blood-cloak is to the east of the great waterfall in Drû Bhûta, atop a large rocky cliff. It is the location where the Wild Men perform their funerary rites.

Khôr-buri-Ghân has gone to the Orc-camp on the road north of the Drúadan Forest.\n\nGhân-buri-Ghân has offered to help the Rohirrim if you will help his youngest son recover the body of his slain eldest.
The Blood-cloak is to the east of the great waterfall in Drû Bhûta, atop a large rocky cliff. It is the location where the Wild Men perform their funerary rites.

'There is sorrow here. There is gladness too. Many Wild Men buried at base of Blood-cloak. We remember them all; we remember Bhai-buri-Ghân.\n\n'Ghân-buri-Ghân grateful for what we did. Grateful as father. Grateful as headman of Wild Men. As headman his command is clear: Wild Men will help Horse-men.'
You should return to Drû Bhûta and speak with Ghân-buri-Ghân.
Khôr-buri-Ghân asked you to draw the enemy's attention by entering the Orc-camp.
DNT - Blah!

'My son Khôr-buri-Ghân not only kin. Bhai-buri-Ghân was eldest, but slain by gorgûn. Body taken to camp on road, north of forest. Khôr-buri-Ghân asked to recover body of brother. Ghân granted request. Help with task, and Ghân will offer aid to horse-men.\n\n'Go now to camp of gorgûn in north-east. Help Khôr-buri-Ghân and Wild Men help you.'
Khôr-buri-Ghân asked you to draw the enemy's attention by entering the Orc-camp, Maudhúl Grak.
Khôr-buri-Ghân is in the depths of Maudhúl Grak, waiting to speak with you.
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân outside the Orc-camp near Amon Dîn
'Many gorgûn inside.'

Ghân-buri-Ghân is in the village of Drû Bhûta.\n\nYou entered Maudhúl Grak near Amon Dîn and recovered the body of Ghân-buri-Ghân's son, slain by Orcs. His other son, Khôr-buri-Ghân, has asked you to return to the Ghân and report your success.
Return to Drû Bhûta
There are many dead Orcs here. Khôr-buri-Ghân has been busy!
You have found more dead Orcs. Khôr-buri-Ghân is further ahead to the north-west
Ghân-buri-Ghân has set before you a task to complete, and if you are successful he has pledged to help the Rohirrim with their passage.

'After you go to the Blood-cloak, Wild Men seek out the Horse-men. We will help them. They need fear no gorgûn. Wild Men know secret way.\n\n'Blood-cloak is to east, atop hill on far side of falling water. My son Bhai-buri-Ghân rests there now.'
'Help Khôr-buri-Ghân and Wild Men help you.'
